original: Berg, Gunnar Teodor, civilingenjör, Tollered, f. 20/3/92 i Norra Vram, Malmöh. 1., av civ :ing. Volrath B. o. Clara Wetche. G. 1. 18 m. Margit E:son Nordin, d. 42; 2. 44 m. Inga Bang Bjerregaard. Barn: Margareta f. 27, Peter o. Ulla 31. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 10, KTH 14, res:o.ff:ex. 17. Dir:-assist. o. driftsing. v. AHngsås Bomullsväv. A-B 17, verkst. dir. där sed. 37, verkst. dir. f. A-B Nordens Tex-tilffabr. i Borås sed. 27, Nääs Fabr. A-B i Tollered sed. 41. Styr :led. i dessa A-B samt i A-B Cellull, Sv. bomullsfabr :fören.. Textilrådet, Gbgs
translated: Berg, Gunnar Teodor, engineer, Tollered, born on March 20, 1892 in Norra Vram, Malmöhus County. Son of engineer Volrath B. and Clara Wetche. First marriage in 1918 to Margit E:son Nordin, who passed away in 1942. Second marriage in 1944 to Inga Bang Bjerregaard. Children: Margareta born in 1927, Peter and Ulla born in 1931. Berg completed his secondary education in Gothenburg in 1910, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm in 1914, and completed his reserve officer training in 1917. He was a director's assistant and production engineer at Ahngsås Cotton Weaving AB from 1917 to 1937 and served as managing director from 1937. He was also managing director of AB Nordens Textile Factory in Borås from 1927 and of Nääs Factory AB in Tollered from 1941. He was on the board of directors of these companies as well as AB Cellull, the Swedish Cotton Manufacturers' Association, the Textile Council and the Gothenburg Chamber of Commerce.
